review.title: Towards a Semantic-based Approach for Modeling Regulatory Documents in Building Industry
review.abstract: Regulations in the Building Industry are becoming increasingly complex and involve more than one technical area. They cover products, components and project implementation. They also play an important role to ensure the quality of a building, and to minimize its environmental impact. In this paper, we are particularly interested in the modeling of the regulatory constraints derived from the Technical Guides issued by CSTB and used to validate Technical Assessments. We first describe our approach for modeling regulatory constraints in the SBVR language, and formalizing them in the SPARQL language. Second, we describe how we model the processes of compliance checking described in the CSTB Technical Guides. Third, we show how we implement these processes to assist industrials in drafting Technical Documents in order to acquire a Technical Assessment; a compliance report is automatically generated to explain the compliance or noncompliance of this Technical Documents.

sections.heading: 2.1 Classification of guides
sections.text: The guides provided for our work contain information to verify the validity of the technical documents supplied by the manufacturers, they are designed to facilitate the understanding and application of the law, and they contain all the structural and dimensional characteristics related to the validation of the construction products. However, our goal is to organize these guides on a query basis that can be evaluated by a system.The organization of this database is based on classification criteria that proceed from the structure of the guides. We propose a classification according to three criteria: Organization by documentary source: We classify a query by type and number of regulatory document from which it emerges, and the guides that reference it. Example: Guide "Coverage and tile," result of DTU 40.211, 40.23, 40.22, 40.21. Organization by domain: Each request or interrogation block is related to a specific scope. Example: Accessibility, we can classify by organization, by EST, by technical solutions, etc.
